content:
• Monday, December 10, 2012
  • KMP

    Kinder Morgan Energy Partners (NYSE:KMP) -3% AH on news it is commencing a public offering of...

    Kinder Morgan Energy Partners (NYSE:KMP) -3% AH on news it is commencing a public offering of 3.9M common units representing limited partner interests.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMCC

    AppliedMicro (AMCC +6%) and Equinix (EQIX +2.3%) rallied after making Evercore's list of top...

    AppliedMicro (AMCC +6%) and Equinix (EQIX +2.3%) rallied after making Evercore's list of top 2013 tech picks: the firm declares AMCC "a deeply undervalued play on the data center" thanks to its ARM server CPU, optical, and datacom products, and is a fan of EQIX's fundamentals and planned REIT conversion. Also making the list are Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), Red Hat (RHT - exposure to open-source software growth and cloud/big data/virtualization trends), and Qualcomm (QCOM - smartphone growth, 4G adoption, and demand for faster processors).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • AIRM

    Air Methods (NASDAQ:AIRM) declares special dividend of $7.00/share. For shareholders of record...

    Air Methods (NASDAQ:AIRM) declares special dividend of $7.00/share. For shareholders of record Dec. 20. Payable Dec. 28. Ex-div date Dec. 18. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • AFAM

    Almost Family (NASDAQ:AFAM) declares special dividend of $2.00/share. For shareholders of record...

    Almost Family (NASDAQ:AFAM) declares special dividend of $2.00/share. For shareholders of record Dec. 20. Payable Dec. 28. Ex-div date Dec. 18. Shares +3.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • CYS

    CYS Investments (NYSE:CYS) declares $0.40/share quarterly dividend. For shareholders of record...

    CYS Investments (NYSE:CYS) declares $0.40/share quarterly dividend. For shareholders of record Dec. 21. Payable Dec. 28. Ex-div date Dec. 19. Additionally, the board declares special dividend of $0.52/share payable with regular dividend. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • HUSA

    Houston American Energy (NYSEMKT:HUSA) -51.5% AH after receiving notice from the operator of its...

    Houston American Energy (NYSEMKT:HUSA) -51.5% AH after receiving notice from the operator of its CPO 4 Block in Colombia that it intends to plug and abandon the Zorro Gris #1 well; following abandonment, the drilling rig will be released.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • LB

    Limited Brands (LTD) declares special dividend of $3.00/share. For shareholders of record Dec....

    Limited Brands (LTD) declares special dividend of $3.00/share. For shareholders of record Dec. 20. Payable Dec. 26. Ex-div date Dec. 18. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • NSPH

    Nanosphere (NSPH +2.5%) says the FDA's granted 510(k) clearance permitting marketing of its...

    Nanosphere (NSPH +2.5%) says the FDA's granted 510(k) clearance permitting marketing of its C.difficile test on the automated Verigene System. The test, which can post results in less than two hours, expands Nanosphere's infectious disease test capabilities. C. difficile infection is a cause of diarrhea that can lead to colitis, other serious intestinal conditions and death, and rapid detection can prevent further spread of the infection.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • CAS

    A.M. Castle (CAS +3.2%) shares are upgraded to Buy from Hold at Topeka Capital after it meets...

    A.M. Castle (CAS +3.2%) shares are upgraded to Buy from Hold at Topeka Capital after it meets with Scott Dolan, the metals distributor's new CEO, and sees a new-found "greater urgency" in making long-needed changes at the company. While macro risks remain, the firm believes the operational and structural changes will dramatically improve CAS earnings potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC -5.9%) dips today after its Board of Directors approves amendments to...

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC -5.9%) dips today after its Board of Directors approves amendments to CTI's existing shareholder rights plan to decrease the exercise price of the preferred stock purchase rights from $14.00 to $8.00 and to extend the final expiration date from January 7, 2010, to December 3, 2015. The Rights were initially distributed as a dividend on CTI's common stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • LYSCF

    Lynas' (OTCPK:LYSCF, OTCPK:LYSDY) plans to ramp up rare earth materials via its new Malaysian...

    Lynas' (OTCPK:LYSCF, OTCPK:LYSDY) plans to ramp up rare earth materials via its new Malaysian plant suffer a setback, as four ministers say it must export waste material in Malaysia or risk having its operating license revoked. The ministers' statement followed reports citing Lynas Malaysia's director as saying the company would not export residue from the plant. MCP +19.8%, AVL +10%, REE +9.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 7 Comments
  • TECK

    Coal companies power higher, perhaps attributable to reports that damage at British Columbia's...

    Coal companies power higher, perhaps attributable to reports that damage at British Columbia's Westshore coal terminal is taking longer to repair than expected. Teck Resources (TCK +2.7%), a top Westshore customer, says it will continue to ship through the second berth at the terminal but explore options for moving additional tonnage elsewhere. CLF +5.1%, ANR +7.9%, WLT +4.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • MAKO

    Mako Surgical (MAKO -4.1%) falls after competitor Blue Belt Technologies received clearance from...

    Mako Surgical (MAKO -4.1%) falls after competitor Blue Belt Technologies received clearance from the FDA to market its NavioPFS orthopedic surgical system for partial knee replacement. MAKO markets its own device, called the RIO robotic system, which, although higher priced, offers some advantages in terms of implant availability, ease of use and broader applications in hips.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • ELX

    Emulex (ELX +3.8%) is higher thanks to an upgrade to Overweight from Stephens. Rivals QLogic...

    Emulex (ELX +3.8%) is higher thanks to an upgrade to Overweight from Stephens. Rivals QLogic (QLGC +2%) and Mellanox (MLNX +4.6%) are also up - the latter might be getting a lift from a deal to supply 40 Gb/s InfiniBand adapter cards and switches for Teradata's (NYSE:TDC) Aster Big Analytics Appliance, which competes with Oracle's Big Data Appliance (it also uses Mellanox gear). Emulex fell last week after announcing it's acquiring network monitoring hardware firm Endace.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (VLO +2.2%) says it will distribute to shareholders 80% of the equity in its 6,800...

    Valero Energy (VLO +2.2%) says it will distribute to shareholders 80% of the equity in its 6,800 retail stations as part of its plans to spin off the business. VLO hopes the spinoff will unlock value in the business, normally a bright spot in its earnings but which struggled in Q3 as average operating income fell to half of year-earlier levels, mostly because fuel margins plunged 40%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -4.3%) has given up some of last week's gains. Oppenheimer's Ittai Kidron offered...

    Nokia (NOK -4.3%) has given up some of last week's gains. Oppenheimer's Ittai Kidron offered mixed commentary this morning. He raised his Q4 and 2013 estimates, claiming checks indicate "decent demand" for both Symbian and Lumia hardware, as well as continued traction for the Asha line. But he also argued the Lumia 920 is benefiting from heavy subsidies and discounting, which he expects will moderate in Q1, and questioned the sustainability of Asha sales as "low-priced and strongly powered" Android gear proliferates.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 8 Comments
  • ALNY

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +5.2%) trades up after reporting encouraging pre-clinical data for...

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +5.2%) trades up after reporting encouraging pre-clinical data for its RNAi therapeutic program to treat of hemophilia and other bleeding disorders. The drug candidate produced up to a four-fold increase in thrombin - a protein that plays a role in blood coagulation - in testing with non-human primates. The company says it eventually plans to have five different medications in clinical development by the end of 2015.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • CSCO

    Cisco (CSCO +2.6%) is rallying as analysts give a thumbs-up to its analyst day. Goldman is...

    Cisco (CSCO +2.6%) is rallying as analysts give a thumbs-up to its analyst day. Goldman is pleased with Cisco's 3-5-year opex guidance, and argues software-defined networking is "an incremental software revenue opportunity rather than a threat," though others feel differently. Raymond James expects services growth to prop up Cisco's margins, and thinks its routing margin pressures (stemming partly from carrier adoption of router bypass tech) indicate "an under-appreciated headwind" for rival Juniper (NYSE:JNPR).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • SPRD

    Chipmakers Spreadtrum (SPRD -6.3%), Marvell (MRVL -1.9%), and Sequans (SQNS -1%) are all off....

    Chipmakers Spreadtrum (SPRD -6.3%), Marvell (MRVL -1.9%), and Sequans (SQNS -1%) are all off. Chinese media reports only 1 of 9 companies taking part in government tests for 4G TD-LTE baseband chips - a group including the aforementioned names - fully met government standards in a test. China Mobile (NYSE:CHL) is plotting a commercial TD-LTE launch, but its timing depends on approval by a government that may chose to bide its time in so that more subscribers are racked up for CHL's 3G network, which relies on home-grown TD-SCDMA tech.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • PRMW

    Primo Water (PRMW +6.8%) gets a lift after saying PRMW) is up 7.56% to $1.14 after the company...

    Primo Water (PRMW +6.8%) gets a lift after saying PRMW) is up 7.56% to $1.14 after the company earlier announced that it has appointed Matt Sheehan as chief operating officer, a newly-created position at the company.">it's appointed Matt Sheehan to the newly created position of chief operating officer. Sheehan will be responsible for overseeing the strategy and growth of the company's water segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • INVN

    InvenSense (INVN +6.3%) is sharply higher after announcing its motion sensor chips are shipping...

    InvenSense (INVN +6.3%) is sharply higher after announcing its motion sensor chips are shipping in large volumes for use in Windows 8 and RT tablets and ultrabooks from tier-1 OEMs. InvenSense noted in its calendar Q3 earnings call STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) has a "dominant position" when it comes to Intel-based Windows motion sensor design wins, thanks to its inclusion in an Intel reference design.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 4 Comments
  • ACUR

    Shares of Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR +43%) soar after launching Nexafed, a pseudoephedrine...

    Shares of Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR +43%) soar after launching Nexafed, a pseudoephedrine product that provides nasal-congestion relief with a unique technology that disrupts the conversion of pseudoephedrine into the dangerous drug, methamphetamine. Nexafed is now available to national and regional drug wholesalers and will be available to pharmacies soon. The stock has been volatile leading up to today's release, a few weeks ago the stock jumped nearly 50% on reports of the drugs imminent availability.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • ASTX

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +2.8%) moves up after presenting encouraging Phase I clinical...

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +2.8%) moves up after presenting encouraging Phase I clinical results of SGI-110, a novel second generation hypomethylation agent, during a presentation at the American Society of Hematology. Data from the trial showed that patients with acute myelogenous leukemia using the drug demonstrated a differentiated pharmacokinetic profile resulting in an extended half-life and exposure to decitabine.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics (STM +3.9%) has caught an upgrade to Buy from BofA/Merrill. Both The upgrade...

    STMicroelectronics (STM +3.9%) has caught an upgrade to Buy from BofA/Merrill. Both The upgrade follows STM's announcement it's in talks to exit its money-losing ST-Ericsson mobile baseband chip JV, which comes after management reportedly failed to agree on splitting up the company's analog and digital chip ops. Shares have staged a decent rally since mid-November.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • MRO

    This morning's resignation of Marathon Oil (MRO -1.8%) CFO David Roberts surprises analysts;...

    This morning's resignation of Marathon Oil (MRO -1.8%) CFO David Roberts surprises analysts; Argus' Philip Weiss, for one, thinks of him "as being highly regarded, as being a good solid number two." The reason for the departure of Roberts, once viewed as a possible successor to CEO Clarence Cazalot, was not given.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • TER

    Teradyne (TER +3%) and Ruckus Wireless (RKUS +7.2%) are two tech names receiving favorable...

    Teradyne (TER +3%) and Ruckus Wireless (RKUS +7.2%) are two tech names receiving favorable coverage launches. Needham has started Teradyne at Buy, arguing it will benefit from a pickup in chip equipment spending (ed:Gartner is forecasting a slight 2013 decline before a 2014 rebound). Lazard has done the same for Ruckus: it expects service provider demand for Wi-Fi as a mobile offload option to keep growing, and for Wi-Fi network deployments among "mid-market enterprises" to increase. Ruckus staged a big rally last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • CBMX

    Midday top 10 gainers: CBMX +37%. UNXL +37%. OTC:ACUR +32%. GERN +25%. IN +23%. CLDX +23%. GPRC...

    Midday top 10 gainers: CBMX +37%. UNXL +37%. OTC:ACUR +32%. GERN +25%. IN +23%. CLDX +23%. GPRC +20%. OTCQB:TELK +19%. SUMR +17%. EJ +16%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: ZGNX -47%. CSFS -25%. MEAD -13%. TCCO -12%. GTIM -11%. SEV -10%. GEO -10%. BLIN -10%. OTC:DCTH -9%. NQ -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CNQR

    Concur Technologies (CNQR +5.7%) is rallying on an upgrade to Buy from Wunderlich's Richard...

    Concur Technologies (CNQR +5.7%) is rallying on an upgrade to Buy from Wunderlich's Richard Baldry: he thinks management's fiscal 1H13 guidance "should prove overly conservative," and foresees 30% Y/Y organic growth in 2H. The travel expense software firm's shares have tread water for much of 2012, as the Street digests its lofty valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • CYCC

    Shares of Cyclacel Pharmaceutical (CYCC -3.9%) slide after releasing updated survival data over...

    Shares of Cyclacel Pharmaceutical (CYCC -3.9%) slide after releasing updated survival data over the weekend from its Phase III studies of its oral sapacitabine capsules, a treatement for elderly patients with newly diagnosed acute myeloid leukemia who are not candidates for chemotherapy. The data was presented at the 54th Annual Meeting of the American Society of Hematology in Atlanta.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • DMND

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND -9%) trade lower following the company's oddly-timed release of...

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND -9%) trade lower following the company's oddly-timed release of FQ4 earnings after the close on Friday. A series of charges related to an accounting scandal and a plant closure affected results while a 16% Y/Y falloff in snack sales doesn't bode well for brands.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 4 Comments
  • NLST

    Microcap Netlist (OTC:NLST +40.2%) has skyrocketed on news all of the claims in a patent...

    Microcap Netlist (OTC:NLST +40.2%) has skyrocketed on news all of the claims in a patent asserted by rival SMART Modular in an infringement suit against Netlist have been rejected by the USPTO on grounds of prior art, following a reexamination. Netlist is fighting for its survival following a difficult Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN -4.7%) and Expedia (EXPE -3.5%) are off after Deutsche downgrades Priceline to...

    Priceline (PCLN -4.7%) and Expedia (EXPE -3.5%) are off after Deutsche downgrades Priceline to Hold on a belief a margin-compressing "Cold War" will break out in European online travel. The culprits: Expedia's growing efforts to acquire customers following an improvement in conversion rates; a declining amount of travel-related Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) PC ad clicks thanks to the mobile shift; and the possibility Google will make a stronger travel search push once its regulatory issues are handled.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK -6.1%) slip after M&A chatter propped up the apparel company...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK -6.1%) slip after M&A chatter propped up the apparel company late last week. Today's action is driven by news the company could be set to markdown Ugg boots with winter weather failing to deliver as promised so far in December.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • GNRC

    Generac Holdings (GNRC -0.9%) gives back early gains and slips into negative territory after...

    Generac Holdings (GNRC -0.9%) gives back early gains and slips into negative territory after announcing it's completed its acquisition of Ottomotores UK Limited and its affiliates, which includes the operations of Ottomotores Mexico and Ottomotores Brazil, for $46.5M in cash.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 5 Comments
  • QIHU

    NetQin (NQ -6.5%) slumps after SA's FJE Research questions the company's user account figures....

    NetQin (NQ -6.5%) slumps after SA's FJE Research questions the company's user account figures. While NetQin claims to have a 63% share of the Chinese mobile security software market, research firms assert Qihoo (NYSE:QIHU) has a 60%+ share. Moreover, download figures for NetQin's security app on Sina and various app stores are meager, and Baidu search activity is also light. NetQin's low valuation indicates there's already some skepticism on the Street about its growth story.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +15.7%) soars, taking the rest of the rare earth sector with it (AVL +6.2%, REE...

    Molycorp (MCP +15.7%) soars, taking the rest of the rare earth sector with it (AVL +6.2%, REE +11%, REMX +1.7%). Traders describe the move as the continuation of a short squeeze in Molycorp - whose shares dropped below 6 in mid-November after being in the mid-30s 7 months earlier. Adding fuel is a report Interactive Brokers has said there is insufficient stock available for short sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 11 Comments
  • GSS

    The election of incumbent John Dramani Mahama as president of Ghana brings renewed concern about...

    The election of incumbent John Dramani Mahama as president of Ghana brings renewed concern about a windfall tax on miners operating there. Golden Star Resources (GSS -2.2%) and Perseus Mining (OTCPK:PMNXF) are two producers will full exposure to Ghana; NEM, KGC, GFI, AU, KGN, PPMIQ.PK and OTC:AZUMF also have some exposure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • GENE

    Genetic Technologies (GENE -0.9%) slips this morning after the company names its COO and acting...

    Genetic Technologies (GENE -0.9%) slips this morning after the company names its COO and acting Chief Executive Alison Mew as its permanent CEO, less than two weeks after its former head, Paul MacLeman - along with several other company executives - resigned. Last month Mr. MacLeman stepped down in protest after GENE's founder, Mervyn Jacobson, used his 29% stake in the company to block the re-election of Chairman Mel Bridges.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • OCLR

    Oclaro (OCLR -5.9%) slides after announcing plans to sell $25M worth of exchangeable senior...

    Oclaro (OCLR -5.9%) slides after announcing plans to sell $25M worth of exchangeable senior notes due 2018. The optical component maker, which has a $153M market cap and sported $85M of debt on its balance sheet as of Sep. 29, only says it will use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes," or to make investments. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 2 Comments
  • CLDX

    Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX +25%) goes on a tear today after reporting positive final results...

    Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX +25%) goes on a tear today after reporting positive final results from Phase 2b studies of its breast cancer treatment CDX-011. Brean Capital was impressed, saying in a note to clients that the treatment "targets a clear and large unmet need," while Oppenheimer raised its price target from $6 to $8 and Jefferies from $7 to $9.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • APA

    Apache (APA -1.9%) shares slump after receiving downgrades at Baird and Deutsche Bank. Baird...

    Apache (APA -1.9%) shares slump after receiving downgrades at Baird and Deutsche Bank. Baird notes brewing tensions in Egypt, growing uncertainty around Kitimat, and a market focused on growth likely set up for a slow-to-turn show-me story in early 2013. DB expects no meaningful improvement in Q4 operating trends and sees downside to 2013 expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC +3%) and Seagate (STX +3.3%) are up after WDC is named one of Barron's top...

    Western Digital (WDC +3%) and Seagate (STX +3.3%) are up after WDC is named one of Barron's top 10 picks for 2013: the paper cites the hard drive maker's rock-bottom valuation, strong balance sheet, and pledge to return 50% of free cash flow to shareholders. It also likes the ongoing growth in storage demand even as PC sales falter; and the stable pricing that stems from WDC and Seagate's combined 80% share of the hard drive market. Seagate was named a top pick for 2012, and is up over 60% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • PLX

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (PLX +0.7%) says its the first patient has been treated in its Phase...

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (PLX +0.7%) says its the first patient has been treated in its Phase I/II clinical trials of PRX-102, its plant cell-expressed, chemically modified enzyme replacement therapy for the treatment of Fabry disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • DVN

    Crosstex Energy Inc. (XTXI +5.2%) is a smart play on rising cash flows at MLP Crosstex Energy LP...

    Crosstex Energy Inc. (XTXI +5.2%) is a smart play on rising cash flows at MLP Crosstex Energy LP (XTEX +3.5%), Barron's suggests. It's all about the beauty of incentive distribution rights, which motivates XTXI to manage the LP's assets effectively and grow the distribution. As the distribution increases, it receives a stepped-up percentage, up to 50%, making it levered to the LP's rising cash flows.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • HPQ

    Is Carl Icahn about to play Santa for H-P (HPQ +2.6%) investors, or is idle speculation fueling...

    Is Carl Icahn about to play Santa for H-P (HPQ +2.6%) investors, or is idle speculation fueling a short-squeeze? Shares of the struggling IT giant are rallying on rumors Icahn is buying shares and will soon let the world know. H-P, which already has a director from activist firm Relational Investors on its board, is now up 27% from its Nov. 20 low. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -4.2%) is giving back a portion of the huge gains it saw on Friday, apparently...

    Groupon (GRPN -4.2%) is giving back a portion of the huge gains it saw on Friday, apparently thanks to Google acquisition rumors, but still remains well above Thursday's close. Evercore's Ken Sena asserts the run-up stems from "a swirl of speculative information and potentially false reports," including one that CEO Andrew Mason was cancelling a conference event (thus suggesting a firing is imminent). Mason is still set to speak at a mobile services conference tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • IONS

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +3.1%) clearly has something that Biogen Idec (BIIB +1.3%) likes -...

    Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS +3.1%) clearly has something that Biogen Idec (BIIB +1.3%) likes - the latter adds a third agreement in the companies' partnership, which will now include the development of drugs for three undisclosed targets to treat neurological or neuromuscular disorders. Biogen will pay Isis $30M upfront, another $200M in milestones for each program, and double-digit royalties on drug sales. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • CMTL

    Comtech (CMTL +5.8%) opens higher after catching an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan, which...

    Comtech (CMTL +5.8%) opens higher after catching an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan, which views Friday's post-earnings selloff as a buying opportunity. Though Comtech expects FQ2 EBITDA to slump due in large part to weak satellite modem sales to the U.S. government, JPM notes the company also expects a strong 2H rebounds, and considers the risk-reward favorable at current depressed levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) +1.5% premarket after saying a drill stem test at its Antelope-3 well in...

    InterOil (NYSE:IOC) +1.5% premarket after saying a drill stem test at its Antelope-3 well in Papua New Guinea confirmed continuity of a "highly productive" reservoir of natural gas and condensate with a maximum gas rate of 44.8M cubic ft./day.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are hovering around zero and not joining Italy in the frenzy...

    Market preview: Stock futures are hovering around zero and not joining Italy in the frenzy that's followed Mario Monti's announcement that he'll quit as PM pretty soon rather than just soonish, as he was due to anyway. The S&P Benchmark is -0.1% but the Dow is +0.05%. Intermec soars 23% on news that Honeywell is buying it, while Zogenix craters 43% after the FDA rejected its pain treatment. Later: Employment Trends Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • IN

    Premarket gainers: IN +23%. GERN +17%. NXY +15%. CLDX +10%. STSI +7%. AAV-OLD +7%.Losers: ZGNX...

    Premarket gainers: IN +23%. GERN +17%. NXY +15%. CLDX +10%. STSI +7%. AAV-OLD +7%.
    Losers: ZGNX -39%. CBMX -18%. DMND -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • CLDX

    Celldex (NASDAQ:CLDX) jumps 9.6% after saying its CDX-011 drug delayed tumor growth and extended...

    Celldex (NASDAQ:CLDX) jumps 9.6% after saying its CDX-011 drug delayed tumor growth and extended the survival of patients with advanced breast cancer compared with those who received single-agent chemotherapy in a Phase II trial. Seattle Genetics (NASDAQ:SGEN) also has an interest in the drug. Celldex now hopes to persuade the FDA to authorize a confirmatory study of CDX-011, which could lead to accelerated approval. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • CEO

    Cnooc (NYSE:CEO) still needs approvals from the U.S. and U.K. governments to complete its...

    Cnooc (NYSE:CEO) still needs approvals from the U.S. and U.K. governments to complete its takeover of Nexen (NXY), but Canada was the key risk as NXY's assets in the U.S. are not material and the British government is investor-friendly, Macquarie analysts say. The U.S. approval process may prove "noisy and emotive in the press," but ultimately the deal will be cleared. NXY +14.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • MCD

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) says global same-store sales rose 2.4% in November, ahead of estimates...

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) says global same-store sales rose 2.4% in November, ahead of estimates calling for a more modest pace of 0.4%. Sales in the U.S. grew at a 2.5% clip, while Europe was up 1.4%. Continued weakness in Japan helped drag down Asia/Pacific, Middle East and Africa growth to 0.6%. MCD +2.8% premarket.
